required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Zero-ischemia Robot-assisted Partial Nephrectomy Using Near-infrared Fluorescence
clinical_study.official_title: Zero-ischemia Robot-assisted Partial Nephrectomy Using Near-infrared Fluorescence: A Prospective, Monocentric, Randomized, Comparative and Open-label Study

collaborator.agency: Clinical Investigation Centre for Innovative Technology Network

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with renal cancer are commonly treated by robot-assisted partial nephrectomy. Renal artery clamping is commonly required inducing kidney ischemia during surgery. It impacts parenchymal and renal function. This study aims to compare a new surgical procedure in order to reduce ischemia effect and preserve renal function after partial nephrectomy for renal tumour.

primary_outcome.measure: Benefit on postoperative renal function of fluorescence-enhanced super-selective clamping during robot assisted partial nephrectomy compared with robot-assisted partial nephrectomy with renal artery clamping
primary_outcome.description: The glomerular filtration rate (GFR) of the kidney operated is assessed at 6 months after surgery. This value is compared to that assessed before the surgery to see the variation. This variation is compare between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of group conversion in the zero ischemia method.
secondary_outcome.description: The feasibility of the new technique is assessed by counting the number of group conversion towards conventional technique.

secondary_outcome.measure: Surgical duration in the two groups
secondary_outcome.description: Duration between the first incision and the skin closure
number of complications per and post-surgery up to 1 month
For patients having no received blood transfusion, the hemoglobine rate variation is assessed in percentage at one month in post-surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Variation between global GFR in the two groups
secondary_outcome.description: The variation of the global GFR is assessed after surgery, when patient is discharged. This value is compared to the that collected before the surgery.
The percentage of renal parenchyma preserved is evaluated by CT renal volumetry at 6 months after the surgery. The value is compared to that collected before the surgery.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy super-selective clamping
arm_group.description: The Da Vinci robot (device) allows to use near-infrared fluorescence in order to clamp precisely the branches of the vascularization for the partial nephrectomy. The healthy parenchyma ischemia is avoided.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy with renal artery clamping
arm_group.description: The partial nephrectomy with robotic assistance is performed using a renal artery. It's the conventional method.

intervention.intervention_name: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy super-selective clamping
intervention.description: The device used to performe the surgery is a Da Vinci robot. After injection of infracyanine, the super-selective clamping is possible. The surgery is performed using a specific clamping of the tumor arteries. Super-selective ischemia is checked using near infrared fluorescence.
intervention.arm_group_label: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy super-selective clamping
intervention.other_name: Robot assisted zero-ischemia partial nephrectomy with the Da Vinci robot (device)

intervention.intervention_name: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy with renal artery clamping
intervention.description: Partial nephrectomy is performed with the conventional method in wich a renal artery clamping is done.
intervention.arm_group_label: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy with renal artery clamping
intervention.other_name: Robot assisted partial nephrectomy with conventional method

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- candidate for a robot-assisted partial nephrectomy for renal tumour
- patient affiliated to social security
- signature of the informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- proven or suspected allergy to the indocyanine green
- coagulation disorder contraindicating robot assistance in the partial nephrectomy
- medical pathology contraindicating pneumo-peritoneum
- multiple tumors
- horseshoe kidney
- exclusion period of another interventionnal study
- protected person referred to in Articles L1121-5 to L1121-8 of the Code of Public Health

overall_official.affiliation: department of urology and renal transplantation
